results.headline: Review: In ‘Survivor,’ a Thriller About Terrorism, Milla Jovovich Is on the Run
results.summary_short: A security inquiry into visa requests leads to assassination attempts in this film directed by James McTeigue.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Survivor

results.headline: Review: In ‘Barely Lethal,’ a Secret Agent Finds High School Highly Perilous
results.summary_short: Hailee Steinfeld plays a truant spy who fakes her death so she can have a normal teenage life. Little did she know....

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Barely Lethal

results.headline: Review: ‘Results’ Tracks Exertions in Matters of the Cardio
results.summary_short: In Andrew Bujalski’s romantic comedy, a personal trainer and her boss find their badinage interrupted by an out-of-shape heir.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Results

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tu Dors Nicole,’ the Daughter Loafs While the Parents Are Away
results.summary_short: This third feature from Stéphane Lafleur follows a woman who takes what she wants on the job at a secondhand store and generally lives an impulsive life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tu dors Nicole

results.headline: Review: In ‘I Believe in Unicorns,’ a Princess Meets Her Punk Prince Charming
results.summary_short: The director Leah Meyerhoff brings her life story to the screen in this work filmed in her childhood home in Oakland, Calif.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I Believe in Unicorns

results.headline: Review: ‘Heaven Knows What’ Dramatizes a Young Junkie’s Life
results.summary_short: Directed by Josh and Benny Safdie, “Heaven Knows What” chronicles an addict and her pursuits on the streets of New York.

results.headline: Review: ‘Unfreedom,’ a Raj Amit Kumar Tale of Sex, Religion and Tradition
results.summary_short: Abduction, sexual orientation and violence are at the core of this drama.

results.headline: Review: ‘The True Cost’ Investigates High Price of Fashion Bargains
results.summary_short: This documentary by Andrew Morgan details the exploitation of workers in garment factories and cotton fields around the world.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The True Cost

results.headline: Review: ‘Sunset Edge,’ Where Mysteries Lurk at an Abandoned Trailer Park
results.summary_short: The first feature film from the director Daniel Peddle follows a mysterious young man whose world intersects with four teenagers hanging out at this deserted location.

results.headline: Review: In ‘San Andreas,’ Dwayne Johnson Rushes to Rescue His Collapsing World
results.summary_short: The big earthquake in this film has its pros and cons: On the one hand, tearing California asunder. On the other, bringing a family together.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of San Andreas

results.headline: Review: ‘Gemma Bovery,’ a Modern Sex Comedy With a Nod to Flaubert
results.summary_short: Anne Fontaine’s film is about the midlife crisis of a man confronted with yearnings he has compartmentalized so effectively they are barely noticeable.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gemma Bovery

results.headline: Review: ‘Aloha,’ a Hangout Movie With Bradley Cooper and Emma Stone in Hawaii
results.summary_short: Cameron Crowe’s loose and leisurely film can be enjoyed the way you enjoy a catch-up beer with an old friend you don’t have much in common with anymore.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Aloha

results.headline: Review: ‘Guidelines’ Is Jean-François Caissy’s Look at High School
results.summary_short: This documentary, filmed in a rural Quebec, features students both contained and let free.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of La marche à suivre

results.headline: Review: ‘When Marnie Was There,’ by Studio Ghibli, Animates a Friendship With Ominous Undertones
results.summary_short: Beneath its calm, exquisitely detailed surface, “When Marnie Was There” bubbles with half-formed ideas and undeveloped themes.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of When Marnie Was There

results.headline: Review: ‘Tomorrowland,’ Brad Bird’s Lesson in Optimism
results.summary_short: There is nothing casual or whimsical about this movie’s celebration of hope, imagination and joy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tomorrowland

results.headline: Review: ‘The Farewell Party’ Finds Laughs in Euthanasia
results.summary_short: In Tal Granit and Sharon Maymon’s Israeli comedy, set at a Jerusalem retirement home, an amateur inventor devises a “mercy-killing machine.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mita Tova

results.headline: Review: ‘Sunshine Superman,’ About the High-Flying Daredevil Carl Boenish
results.summary_short: This documentary, directed by Marah Strauch, is a bittersweet take on a man who looked at very tall things and saw an opportunity to jump.

results.headline: Review: ‘Seeds of Time,’ a Documentary on a Crusader for Crop Diversity
results.summary_short: The urgency of expanding the world’s seed portfolio is made eminently clear in this film directed by Sandy McLeod.

results.headline: Review: ‘Love at First Fight,’ a Romance in the Wild
results.summary_short: Adèle Haenel stars in this film about a woman out to prove how tough she is; her savior ends up being a man, though.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Something Better to Come,’ Growing Up in a Garbage Dump
results.summary_short: Hanna Polak’s documentary visits Yula and the rest of a community squatting for years in a landfill outside wealthy Moscow.
